item.title: Report X-2024100486
item.description:
Report X-2024100486

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-09T09:22:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-02
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: CONTENTS OF ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED DUE TO THE OUTER BOX WAS SLIGHTLY WET. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY THREE POUNDS OF EMORY DRY ICE COOLING SOUTHERN BAKED PIES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED IN THE AIR NETWORK. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2024100479
item.description:
Report X-2024100479

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-09T09:22:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-02
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE THAT WAS HISSING. THE PACKAGE WAS MARKED AND LABELED UN1956 COMPRESSED GAS, N.O.S. (NITROGEN DIOXIDE, NITROGEN) WITH THE CLASS 2.2 DIAMOND LABEL AND IATA SHIPPERS DECLARATION. THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE CYLINDER LEAKING. THE RESPONDER REMOVED THE CAP AND TIGHTENED THE VALVE TO STOP THE LEAK.

item.title: Report E-2024100198
item.description:
Report E-2024100198

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-09T09:22:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-09
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1318 ET, XPO terminal XFK notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported approximately 8 ounces of UN1824 Butler MWW Detergent released from 1 cardboard container due to improper packing from the shipper. The release impacted trailer # 4414472. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site due to the product being a corrosive. The Service Center Manager stated that terminal will proceed with cleanup the spill was contained to the box product is housed in. The waste was containerized in a 10-Gallon poly drum and staged for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024100357
item.description:
Report X-2024100357

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-26
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY, WE DISCOVERED ONE STEEL DRUM DAMAGED AND LEAKING. THE DRUM WAS FULLY MARKED AND LABELED AS UN1993 FLAMMABLE LIQUID NOS WITH AN IATA SHIPPERS DECLARATION. THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. UPON INSPECTION THERE IS A HOLE IN THE TOP OF THE STEEL DRUM AND THE SIDES OF THE DRUM ARE DENTED FROM UNKNOWN SOURCES. APPROXIMATELY 3 L OF THE 13.6 L QUANTITY LEAKED FROM THE DRUM. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM ILLINOIS USING UPS ACCOUNT X61148, ADHESIVE SYSTEMS, 9411 CORSAIR RD FRANKFORT IL 60423.

item.title: Report X-2024100378
item.description:
Report X-2024100378

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-25
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT WAS LEAKING. UPON INSPECTION OUTER BOX BEARS A DOCUMENT INDICATING HAZARDOUS MATERIALS SHIPPING PAPER PRINTED ON WHITE PAPER WITH DANGEROUS GOODS BASIC DESCRIPTION MOSTLY COVERED BY A THERMAL TRACKING LABEL. THERE ARE NO ADDITIONAL DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER FIBERBOARD BOX. INNER CONTENT INSPECTION REVEALS ONE GALLON PAIL OF SIKADUR 52 MARKED AND LABELED AS UN3267 CORROSIVE LIQUID BASIC ORGANIC NOS (PHENOL, 4-NONYL, BRANCHED, 2-PIPERAZIN-1-YLETHYLAMINE), 8, PG II. THE BOTTOM OF THE PAIL APPEARS DENTED WITH CONTENTS LEAKING FROM THAT AREA.

item.title: Report E-2024100090
item.description:
Report E-2024100090

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-05T09:31:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-24
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 24, 2024, twelve 1-gallon pails of paint were knocked over by a forklift and released approximately twelve (12) gallons of paint to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from TPM-Group (TPM) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted site. The damaged pails were containerized in one (1) 65-gallon drum. All spent absorbents and debris were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.
